documentType: grand jury subpoena and responsive bank records
summary: This document contains a June 29, 2020 grand jury subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to USAA Federal Savings Bank, requesting extensive financial records for Ghislaine Maxwell and related entities from November 2019 onward. The response includes bank records showing a joint checking account opened in 2012 between Scott Borgerson and Ghislaine Maxwell, and a later amendment where Maxwell voluntarily removed herself from the account. This document contains bank statements and credit card statements for a joint checking account held by Scott Borgerson and Ghislaine Maxwell, as well as a credit card account in the name of Scott G Borgerson with Ghislaine Borgerson as an authorized user. The records cover the period from October 2019 to June 2020, showing regular transactions, payments, and transfers between accounts. A letter from ClaimFox, Inc., a third-party vendor for USAA Federal Savings Bank, to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. It states that USAA has no bank records for several named entities (Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, Max Hotel Service Corp) and an unspecified account number in response to a subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of grand jury subpoena, former joint account holder
persons.context: The grand jury subpoena explicitly requests all records pertaining to her, along with several entities linked to her (Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, Max Hotel Services Corp). Bank records show she was a joint account holder with Scott Borgerson on a USAA Classic Checking account opened in 2012, and she later voluntarily removed herself from the account.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: Bank records identify him as the primary applicant and joint account holder with Ghislaine Maxwell on a USAA Classic Checking account opened on April 16, 2012. His address is listed as Gloucester, MA.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She signed the grand jury subpoena dated June 29, 2020, as the Attorney for the United States and Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Scott G Borgerson
persons.context: Primary account holder for USAA credit card ending in 5034, with Ghislaine Borgerson as an authorized user. Address listed as Manchester, MA 01944-1540.

persons.name: Ghislaine Borgerson
persons.context: Authorized user on Scott G Borgerson's USAA credit card, with transactions primarily from Amazon and Audible. Name appears as 'Ghislaine Borgerson' on credit card statements.

persons.name: Jarreau Pelote
persons.context: Recipient of a $500 funds transfer from the Scott Borgerson/Ghislaine Maxwell checking account on April 7, 2020.

connections.description: They were joint holders of a USAA Classic Checking account opened on April 16, 2012, as shown on a signature card amendment.
Shared credit card account where Scott G Borgerson is primary holder and Ghislaine Borgerson is authorized user with separate transaction listings.
Appear to be the same individual based on matching address (Manchester, MA 01944-1540) and financial transfers between accounts.
Appear to be the same individual based on matching address and connection to Scott Borgerson/Scott G Borgerson.
Transferred $500 to Jarreau Pelote's checking account on April 7, 2020.

events.title: ClaimFox Response to Subpoena
events.description: ClaimFox, Inc., on behalf of USAA Federal Savings Bank, responds to a subpoena from the US Attorney's Office, stating no bank records exist for several specified entities and an account number.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY)
40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY (United States Courthouse)
10750 McDermott Freeway, San Antonio, TX 78288 (USAA Federal Savings Bank)
Manchester, MA 01944 (Ghislaine Maxwell's address on bank record)
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena dated June 29, 2020, sought extensive financial records for Ghislaine Maxwell and several entities (Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, Max Hotel Services Corp) from USAA Bank.
Bank records produced in response show Ghislaine Maxwell and Scott Borgerson were joint account holders on a USAA Classic Checking account opened on April 16, 2012.
A signature card amendment shows Ghislaine Maxwell later voluntarily rescinded her authority and was removed from the joint account with Scott Borgerson.
The subpoena is part of an ongoing criminal investigation into suspected violations of federal law, including 18 U.S.C. ยง 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested the bank not disclose the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
Ghislaine Maxwell and Scott Borgerson held a joint checking account at USAA Federal Savings Bank from at least October 2019 to June 2020.
Ghislaine Maxwell appears to have used the surname 'Borgerson' on credit card statements as an authorized user on Scott G Borgerson's account.
A $3,560.55 wire transfer was received on March 17, 2020, from UBS AG referencing 'Scott Trust' and addressed to the law firm Nutter McClennen & Fish LLP.
Regular $10 monthly checks were written to the USCG Academy Alumni Association Inc from the joint checking account.
The credit card statements show extensive purchases by both Scott G Borgerson and Ghislaine Borgerson, including frequent Amazon purchases by Ghislaine.
USAA Federal Savings Bank, via its vendor ClaimFox, Inc., was served a subpoena by the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The subpoena sought bank records for Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, Max Hotel Service Corp, and a specific account number.
USAA FSB reported having no bank records for any of the named entities or the account number.
The response indicates an active financial investigation by federal prosecutors into entities potentially linked to the Epstein case.
The document is dated July 6, 2020, showing investigative activity well after Epstein's death in August 2019.
